availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
Kentucky native. Son of George Morrin and Catherine Morrin. Farmer in Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Teacher in 1864.
Served in the 53rd Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as private and first lieutenant from October 24, 1864, to May 19, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, District 2, p. 121B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Brooklyn, p. 674.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0458.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 529.
